column2: WYOMING DMV WRITTEN TEST
Question Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. When the traffic light is green, but traffic is blocking the intersection, drivers should:
column4: honk their horn to establish their right-of-way.
column6: enter the intersection and wait for traffic to clear.
column8: not enter the intersection until they can get completely across.

column2: 2. Regulation signs normally are:
column8: white triangles.

column2: 3. Two motorcyclists are allowed to:
column6: share the lane with another vehicle.
column8: ride side-by-side in a single lane.

column2: 4. What does the flashing signal in the picture indicate?
column4: Pedestrians should finish crossing the street if started.
column6: The same thing as a stop sign.
column8: Pedestrians should start crossing the street.

column2: 5. Road signs that point out scenic areas and parks are:
column8: green and white.

column2: 6. If your front wheels start to skid, the first thing you should do is:
column4: Speed up, pump your brakes and steer in the direction the vehicle is trying to go.
column6: Take your foot off the gas pedal and shift to neutral.
column8: Immediately turn in the direction you want to go.

column2: 7. When a school bus is picking up or dropping off children, you must:
column4: slow down and pass the bus with caution.
column6: stop regardless of your direction of travel.
column8: stop if you are driving in the same direction.

column2: 8. A crosswalk is:
column6: the area where pedestrians may cross the road.
column8: an area designated for blind persons.

column2: 9. Which of the following must you obey over the others?
column8: Stop sign

column2: 10. This road sign means:
column4: This lane is reserved for bicyclists
column8: Bicycles have the right-of-way

column2: 11. To avoid traction loss from hydroplaning, drivers should:
column8: apply the brakes as soon as the car starts to skid.

column2: 12. This warning sign:
column4: indicates the suggested highest safe speed.
column6: provides advance notice to upcoming speed limit change.
column8: shows the current speed limit that all vehicles traveling in the direction of the arrow must not exceed.

column2: 13. This road sign means:
column4: Divided highway ahead - stay to the right
column8: Do not enter

column2: 14. You may drive faster than the posted speed limit:
column4: when passing another vehicle, as long as it is safe to do so.
column8: when your lane is empty.

column2: 15. Bicyclists must:
column4: remain near the left edge of the road.
column6: ride in a bicycle lane, if available.
column8: remain to the right when they prepare for a left turn.

column2: 16. What should you do if your vision through the windshield becomes blocked?
column4: Open the side window so you can see.
column8: All of the above.

column2: 17. Are drivers allowed to exceed the speed limit to pass other vehicles?
column4: Yes, but only if they drive with caution.
column8: Yes, but only by 10 MPH or less.

column2: 18. This road sign tells drivers that:
column4: they must turn either to the right or left.
column8: the one-way street or roadway ahead ends.

column2: 19. This sign warns that:
column8: the bridge ahead is wide enough for only one vehicle at a time.

column2: 20. Never make a U-turn from:
column6: the left part of the lane nearest to the centerline of the roadway.
column8: the lane you’re in.

column2: 21. Diamond-shaped signs:
column6: are used to warn of hazards on roadways.
column8: typically provide guidance to drivers.

column2: 22. A diamond-shaped sign is a:
column8: warning sign.

column2: 23. This sign warns drivers of:
column8: a low place in the road.

column2: 24. When passing a vehicle,  it is safe to return to your lane when:
column4: you look over your shoulder and see no vehicle behind you.
column6: the driver you just passed signals you over.
column8: you can see both headlights of the vehicle you passed in your rearview mirror.

column2: 25. When being passed by another vehicle, drivers should:
column8: maintain a constant speed.

column2: 26. You are considered to be driving under the influence when your blood alcohol concentration (BAC) is ____ or more.
27. The yield sign is ___ and white, with ___ letters.
column8: yellow; black

column2: 28. This road sign means:
column8: Divided highway ahead

column2: 29. This sign means:
column4: Parking is not allowed at 8:30 AM and at 5:30 PM
column6: No parking between 8:30 AM and 5:30 PM.
column8: You can only park between 8:30 AM and 5:30 PM.

column2: 30. In 55 MPH traffic you are least likely to be involved in a collision if you:
column4: drive a few MPH faster than most.
column8: drive a few MPH slower than most.

column2: 31. This sign means:
column8: Sharp right turn ahead.

column2: 32. To prevent a fatigue-related crash while driving:
column4: continue driving so you will reach your destination sooner.
column6: drive at night when there are not as many vehicles on the roadway.
column8: find a safe parking area to take a 15 to 20 minute nap.

column2: 33. This sign indicates that:
column4: drivers may not turn right if traveling at 25 MPH or less.
column6: the highest safe speed drivers should travel around the curve ahead is 25 MPH.
column8: the safe speed around the curve ahead is at least 25 MPH.

column2: 34. The ‘One Way’ sign means that:
column4: there is only one road that turns left at the intersection.
column6: drivers may travel only in the direction of the arrow.
column8: only vehicles turning left may travel in the direction of the arrow.

column2: 35. After passing a vehicle, it is safe to return to your lane when:
column4: the driver you passed slows down to let you return to your lane.
column6: you are at least 100 feet ahead of the vehicle you passed.
column8: you can see both headlights of the vehicle you just passed in your rearview mirror.

column2: 36. This sign means:
column8: Drivers will soon be on a roadway with two-way traffic.

column2: 37. This road sign means:
column6: Drivers are about to enter a one way street the wrong way
column8: Drivers may proceed if the way is clear

column2: 38. Are bicyclists required to obey traffic laws and signs?
column6: No, bicyclists are considered pedestrians when it comes to the rules of the road.
column8: Yes, but only if they are riding in a bicycle lane.

column2: 39. If the entrance lane is too short to allow acceleration to highway speed, you should:
column4: go to the next entrance ramp.
column6: stop and wait for a large gap in traffic, then enter the highway and accelerate quickly.
column8: merge into highway traffic as soon as possible.

column2: 40. Before a school bus stops to load passengers, the driver will usually flash:
column8: red lights.

column2: 41. When passing another vehicle, you should:
column4: assume the other vehicle will maintain a constant speed.
column6: check your mirrors and blind spots.
column8: drive at the same speed as the vehicle you are passing.

column2: 42. To keep the driver behind you at a safe distance you should:
column4: drive 5 MPH slower than the car behind.
column6: drive 5 MPH faster than the car behind.
column8: keep a steady speed.

column2: 43. This road sign means:
column8: You may turn right after yielding the right-of-way to oncoming traffic

column2: 44. On slippery roads, drivers should:
column4: leave more space in front of their vehicle.
column8: increase their speed to avoid hydroplaning.

column2: 45. If the vehicle you are driving starts to skid, you should:
column8: stay off the brakes.

column2: 46. You are driving in the far right lane of a four lane freeway and notice broken white lines on the left side of your lane. You are driving:
column8: in a special lane for slow moving vehicles.

column2: 47. When the road is slippery you should:
column8: decrease the following distance.

column2: 48. When they see a yellow X signal, drivers should:
column4: come to a complete stop at the marked stop line.
column8: prepare to leave the lane safely.

column2: 49. Fatigue increases the risk of:
column8: missing an exit.

column2: 50. This road sign means:
column8: No left turn
